result.execSummary:
The defendant Spencer C Stollfus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant may petition Court in writing, after probation completed, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new convictions and probation successfully completed.

Complete anger management counseling.   

DNA sample be submitted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Spencer C Stollfus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to be discharged from probation on 2-3-17; unpaid court obligations of $443
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: imposing 30 days of conditional jail time w/Huber for work and treatment,
Filed by probation agent Amy Heimann by fax, requesting conditional jail time due to probation violations, and waiver of appearance signed by defendant,with proposed order.
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken

Defendant Spencer C Stollfus in court with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 1 yr. probation, $443 costs, complete anger management counseling.   Defendant may petition Court in writing, after probation completed, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new convictions and probation successfully completed. DNA sample be submitted. Ct. 2 read in and dismissed. Court granted 5 days jail credit.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Yaskal
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: from Atty Yaskal to Atty Eagon re: discovery material

Court called 1:03pm/1:04pm. Defendant, Spencer C Stollfus, appeared. Petition is reviewed and defendant states it is not correct, he is no longer employed. Court wants defendant to re-apply with Public Defenders office, he should qualify, if not he is to let the court know.
Public Defender Eligibility Eval Form - by fax
For Court Appointed Atty filed by defendant.
standard misdemeanor conditions, no contact w/K.A.K.

Defendant Spencer C Stollfus in court, in custody by video with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $1,000.00 sign bond, standard misdemeanor conditions, no contact w/K.A.K.,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Return date scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
